name: strictly
posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that would bring severe punishment if not obeyed

example.eg: The speed limit is strictly enforced on urban roads.
example.egtrans: 城市道路上严格限速行驶。

example.eg: The use of cameras in this museum is strictly forbidden.
example.egtrans: 本博物馆中严禁使用相机。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a very limited or limiting way

example.eg: Should I mark this letter to your accountant "strictly confidential"?
example.egtrans: 我是否应该把这封给你会计师的信标注上“绝密”字样？

example.eg: The proposed change in the law would make abortion illegal except for strictly defined medical reasons.
example.egtrans: 对该法拟议中的修改将把堕胎列为非法行为，只有经严格界定属医学需要者除外。

example.eg: This unrepeatable offer is only available for a strictly limited period.
example.egtrans: 这么好的条件，机会难得稍纵即逝。

example.eg: I have acted strictly in accordance with the regulations at all times.
example.egtrans: 我自始至终都是严格照章办事。

example.eg: It is essential that the safety procedures are strictly adhered to.
example.egtrans: 必须严格遵守安全规程。

example.eg: Their salaries are not strictly comparable (= cannot be directly compared) because of the differences in UK and US tax rates.
example.egtrans: 由于英美两国的税率不同，他们的薪酬严格来讲不能相提并论。

example.eg: Are all these questions strictly (= really) necessary?
example.egtrans: 所有这些问题真有必要吗？
